title: Thursday morning news briefing: Reaching the end of the Brexit deal road
text:
PS: Matt gives Brexit a break and is inspired by the curious "WAGatha Christie" investigation by Coleen Rooney for today's cartoon.

Ban all eating on trains and buses, says chief medical officer

If you are about to eat breakfast on public transport, look away now. England's Chief Medical Officer has said eating or drinking on trains and buses should be banned to bring an end to the country's "mindless" snack culture. In her final report, Dame Sally Davies also called for more taxes on unhealthy foods and said chocolate bars and crisps should be in plain wrapping, similar to cigarettes.

Death of conversation? Glued to our phones, but no one calls

A quarter of mobile phone users make fewer than five calls a month, new figures from Ofcom figures have revealed. Of those who did make calls, 60 per cent ended their conversation in less than 90 seconds. Research has also found that younger people find making phone calls daunting and prefer to use messaging services. Do you agree? Have your say in the comments of this story.

Heavy load | The body of a humpback whale is lifted on to a transporter in Gravesend, Kent, after dying in the River Thames. Experts had hoped the whale, nicknamed Hessy, would find its way back to the sea after being spotted in the estuary on Sunday. Read more and click through our pictures of the day gallery.
